Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the findings of the Pentagon study by falsely suggesting that the flu vaccine increases the risk of contracting COVID-19 by 36%.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the flu shot increases the chances of getting COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a causal relationship between the flu shot and an increased risk of COVID-19 without sufficient evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that federal health officials and experts recommend getting the flu shot to control the spread of influenza.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or factors that could contribute to the risk of contracting COVID-19, apart from the flu shot.
Understate: The claim understates the importance of the flu shot in preventing hospitalizations and protecting vulnerable populations from influenza.
